name: strawberry production, in heated greenhouse | strawberry | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15710/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of strawberry . The reference flow is the average yield per ha.yr and year, from 2009 - 2012: yield (100t/ha.y) obtained under irrigated conditions (total amount of water 822 m3/ha.y). The data are representative for strawberry production in Switzerland under heated greenhouse conditions. Typically, greenhouses are heated from March to May as to enable a first early harvest. Greenhouses are then non-heated from May to October which results in two additional harvests. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 480-180-640 kg/ha. No organic fertilisers are applied. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 45.8 kg a.i./ha.;The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market.;PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 2.0 (i.e. very good quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

This activity starts with soil cultivation after the harvest of the previous crop.

This activity ends with harvest and transport to the farm gate. Storage is not included. 
The dataset includes all activities during a cycle, i.e. all machine operations, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations include: soil cultivation, fertilisation, pesticide application, harvesting, and on-farm transport. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. Irrigation is included, as well as greenhouses infrastructures and energy consumption when relevant. The inputs of seedlings, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered. Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0125:Growing of other tree and bush fruits and nuts

processDocumentation.samplingDescription: WFLDB Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products in the latest version, available at: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports. Data sources: Data were categorised from level 0 (L0) to level (L4) as follows: L0 = estimate, proxy; L1 = statistical data (e.g. FAOSTAT); L2 = L1 adapted to crop and country; L3 = literature data or L1 resp. L2 data approved by experts; medium detailing (i.e. kg of total N-fertiliser); L4 = L3 data of high detailing (i.e. portion N-fertiliser types).In this dataset data were obtained for yield: L3; Fertilisers: L4; Pesticides: L1; Machinery: L0; Irrigation: L2. For information regarding the calculation of individual exchanges see supporting documentation WFLDB-Documentation.pdf

exchanges.description: Yield = 100000.0 kg/ha

Original comment of the exchange is: Calculated based on literature values or expert estimation: The total amount of nutrient (Stoessel et al. 2012) multiplied by the country-share of fertiliser type (IFA 2014). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Fertiliser application' for L3 and L4 data  (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
Corresponds to 306 kg N/ha

flow.name: Transformation, to arable land, unspecified use
flow.category: Elementary flows/Resource/land

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of strawberry is calculated to be circa 4.58E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'acetamide-anillide-compound, unspecified', 'boric acid, anhydrous, powder', 'glyphosate', 'pyrethroid-compound', 'trichloromethane'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 9.15E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: This represent the transport of fertilizers that are directly linked to their supplying activities, to better represent the fertilizer mix of the activity. Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Of the total road transport, 6% is assumed to be by delivery van for goods with a large share of retail sale, and 3% for goods that are mainly sold via wholesale.

exchanges.description:
The exchange has been updated from 'calcium ammonium nitrate' into 'calcium ammonium nitrate' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.0018 kg by 3.7037 kg of 'calcium ammonium nitrate' per kg of 'calcium ammonium nitrate'. Original comment of the exchange is: Calculated based on literature values or expert estimation: The total amount of nutrient (Stoessel et al. 2012) multiplied by the country-share of fertiliser type (IFA 2014). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Fertiliser application' for L3 and L4 data  (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
Corresponds to 306 kg N/ha

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'strawberry' is calculated to be circa 1.30E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonia, liquid', 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium fertiliser, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.60E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
